metaData.Fp Seller Name: THE LIQUOR SHOP SINGAPORE PTE LTD
metaData.Key Information:
Well-rounded, solid malt backbone, and very drinkable. These are the main characteristics of this impressive blend. Honeysuckle, vanilla-coated malt and fruit (pineapple upside down cake, lemon tart, plum, bramble) are the primary flavors. Ripe barley, marzipan, beeswax, and clove round out the palate. Gentle, soothing finish.

Gold - International Spirits Challenge 2006 / 2009 / 2013 / 2014 Trophy - International Wine & Spirits Competition 2010 Whisky Advocate: 90 points (Dave Broom) Hakushu 18 Years Japanese Whisky; silky with floral notes. Built amidst the deepest forests of Mt. Kaikomagatake in the Japanese Southern Alps, the Hakushu Distillery is without question one of the highest distilleries in the world. Colour: Deep gold Nose: Ripe pear, dried mint, oregano, hint of smoke Palate: Jasmine, mango, quince, menthol Finish: Long, pleasantly smoked, hint of bitterness

metaData.Key Information:
Hibiki Japanese Harmony Master's Select is a meticulous blend of the finest select whiskeys from the House of Suntory. A symphony of at least 10 malt and grain whiskeys, aged in 5 different types of cask, from Suntorys Yamazaki, Hakushu and Chita distilleries. Overseen by third-generation master blender and great-grandson of the founder, Shingo Torii, and developed by fourth Chief Blender Shinji Fukuyo, this noble and harmonious blend features hints of Yamazaki sherry cask.

metaData.Key Information:
Nose: Seductive scents of honey, vanilla, and coconut from the oak lure in the nose, with a hint of soft white florals to present a refined introduction. Palate: As the honey carries though, peaking through are glimmers of buttery brown sugar and cinnamon with a touch of yuzu zest. Finish: The evolution continues, with flavours developing into sherried date and plum, while oak is present round it out.

metaData.Key Information:
Give the gift of taste and prosperity this Chinese New Year with Johnnie Walkers Blue Label Year of the Ox limited edition design. This Blue Label bottle design has been intricately illustrated by award-winning artist Shirley Gong. The ox is a symbol of prosperity and growth, celebrating good fortune and great achievements.\nThe illustration is matched by the rare whiskies and centuries of craft that creates the rich fruity flavours, effortlessly balanced smoke, and a remarkable depth of character waiting to be discovered.\nThe Johnnie Walker Limited Edition Chinese New Year design is the perfect whisky gift to wish colleagues and close friends a prosperous start to the new year and to mark the beginning of 2021s Spring Festival. Crafted with a design to inspire people to think about the future in a positive and optimistic way a gift that offers people hope for the coming year.

metaData.Key Information:
Nose : A lively nose for the style, presenting both classic vanilla and spicy star anise, but also sea salt and remnants of berries. Palate : A delicate sweetness of candied almonds, toffee, and salted caramel is well balanced by the oak starting to come through to create an experience on the palate. Finish : Just as the sweetness begins to subside, a hint of char arises, almost as if giving a light smokiness to the otherwise honeyed flavours.

metaData.Fp Seller Name: THE LIQUOR SHOP SINGAPORE PTE LTD
metaData.Key Information:
Rich and sherried 15yo malt from one of the best distilleries in Speyside. Aged for a little bit longer and bottled a little stronger for a more concentrated, richer flavour. As always, Glenfarclas remains one of the best-value malts on the market a must for lovers of sherried whisky. Glenfarclas 15 is for many, the best in the Glenfarclas range. Still a family owned distillery since 1865, they use mostly ex sherry casks to create a rich & spicy whisky. The warehouses are tradtional dunnage warehouses, which are so cold they offer very little spare spirit. This Speyside distillery produces their aged whiskies by marrying sherry-cask single malts with oak-cask single malts at an approximate ratio of 2:1.

metaData.Fp Seller Name: THE LIQUOR SHOP SINGAPORE PTE LTD
metaData.Key Information:
The oldest of three Mortlach single malts unveiled in mid-2018 (alongside theMortlach 12 Year OldandMortlach 16 Year Old), this expression matured for 20 years exclusively in sherry casks. Intensely flavoursome stuff (as we've come to expect from Mortlach). The elegant oldie in the Mortlach range, channeling The Beast of Dufftown (the distillery's nickname) into a more refined form. Matured solely in sherry casks, the whisky has been crafted to match rich and dark sherry character against old, refined oaky notes. It's one to take time with, well-balanced and complex, with much more going on than you might expect. Nose:Dense, elegant and intriguing. Dried fruit, cedar wood, leather and tobacco. Body:Robust and rich. Palate clinging.

metaData.Fp Seller Name: THE LIQUOR SHOP SINGAPORE PTE LTD
metaData.Key Information:
Niigata is known in Japan for its Three White treasures, i.e. snow, rice and sake, and a naturally blessed environment for pure water source. SHINOBU means Forbearance in Japanese as it is how the distillers spirit should be when making quality whisky. Shinobu Whisky is hand crafted by the creative distiller, Mr. Usami, by carefully selecting whisky from around the world which are first reserved in ex-sherry and ex-bourbon casks and then finishing them with precious Japanese Mizunara oak in Japan. The result is a unique fusion of flavours and dynamic explosion in palate yet so smooth and easy to drink. All natural with no colouring.\n\nTASTING NOTES BY 2019 ULTIMATE SPIRITS CHALLENGE
